Description: Spatial biology is a key frontier for cancer research, diagnostics, and treatment monitoring. The technological requirements to support different tissue types and applications are very diverse, and platform versatility has thus become paramount. Much-needed adaptability in assay design and sample compatibility for spatial biology research is now enabled by CellScape™ Precise Spatial Multiplexing. This symposium highlights recent technological developments that expand the capabilities of the CellScape platform and provides illustrations of cutting-edge cancer research that leverages this technology in studies that explore the spatial relationships underlying heterogeneous cell migrations and the role of lipocalin-2 in promoting breast cancer metastasis.
Location: Spotlight Theater C - Sails Pavilion - Conv Ctr
SearchResultBody: ESP5C. Bringing Versatility to Spatial Biomarker Detection

Title: Bringing Versatility to Spatial Biomarker Detection
